title: Creamy Strawberry Crepes Recipe
description: This strawberry crepe recipe makes delicate crepes filled with fluffy cream cheese and fresh strawberries for a fancy brunch or mouthwatering snack.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Crepes Sweet Creamy Strawberry Crepes 4.8 (391) 277 Reviews 111 Photos This strawberry crepe recipe has been a family favorite for over 30 years! These crepes are delicious and very rich! Be sure you have at least 1 hour to prepare them; they are worth every minute! Submitted by meliss Updated on June 20, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 111 111 111 111 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Yield: 12 filled crepes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ¾ cup all-purpose flour ½ cup milk ½ cup water 3 eggs 3 tablespoons butter, melted ½ teaspoon salt 1 ¼ cups sifted confectioners' sugar 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened 1 tablespoon lemon juice 1 teaspoon lemon zest ½ teaspoon vanilla extract 1 cup heavy cream, whipped 4 cups sliced strawberries Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place flour, milk, water, eggs, melted butter, and salt into a blender; blend until smooth and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat confectioners' sugar, cream cheese, lemon juice, lemon zest, and vanilla with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gently fold in whipped cream. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a lightly oiled griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour or scoop batter onto the griddle, using approximately 2 tablespoons for each crepe. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Tip and rotate the pan to spread batter as thinly as possible. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Flip over when batter is set and edges begin to brown. Continue cooking until bottom begins to brown. Stack finished crepes on a plate; cover with a damp towel. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Fill each crepe with 1/4 cup sliced strawberries and 1/3 cup cream cheese filling. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roll up and top with a dollop of cream cheese filling and more sliced strawberries. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 981 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 557 Calories 37g Fat 49g Carbs 10g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 557 % Daily Value * Total Fat 37g 47% Saturated Fat 22g 111% Cholesterol 205mg 68% Sodium 406mg 18% Total Carbohydrate 49g 18% Dietary Fiber 3g 9% Total Sugars 32g Protein 10g 20% Vitamin C 62mg 69% Calcium 115mg 9% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 319mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy Strawberry Crepes 01 of 111 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 111 Photo by  Wolfemann 04/18/2022 This was a very good recipe but like others I cut down on the sugar which I thought was perfect. I also drizzled chocolate sauce over the top. Delicious!! 03 of 111 Photo by  Tom Hutchison 06/12/2021 04 of 111 Photo by  Cherry on top 03/24/2021 05 of 111 Photo by  Anita Keys 02/18/2021 Fantastic recipe! I used Pillsbury Gluten Free Flour blend (wheat sensitivity) and these were just as good, if not better than what I remember from iHop. 06 of 111 Photo by  Kristopher Croom 01/31/2021 07 of 111 Photo by  MeganRei 01/16/2021 This recipe was simple to make. My daughters enjoyed them. We didn’t have lemons—so we used orange juice and orange zest instead. The cream cheese mix was on the sweet side...we plan on cutting back to 3/4 cup of powdered sugar the next time. 08 of 111 Photo by  TARA 09/20/2020 09 of 111 Photo by  Marie Guzman 06/07/2020 10 of 111 Photo by  Susan Rose Vanderzille 05/30/2020 This recipe is so easy to follow. This was my first time making crepes and it was delicious! Definitely going to he a part of my repertoire. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Strawberry Crepes 75 Ratings Chef John's Strawberry Crêpe Cake 17 Ratings Dessert Crepes with Raspberry Sorbet 1 Rating Yummy Apple Cinnamon Crepes 24 Ratings Beer Batter Crepes with Banana Cream Cheese Filling 4 Ratings Easy Strawberry Ice Cream 277 Ratings Grandma Irena's Palacsinta (Hungarian Crepes) 23 Ratings Summer Fruit Shortcakes 7 Ratings Strawberry Cheesecake 319 Ratings Egg-White Crepes 102 Ratings Easy Savory Crêpes 25 Ratings Fluffy Swedish Pancakes 117 Ratings Strawberry Banana Pie 12 Ratings Crêpes Suzette 2 Ratings Banana Crepes 334 Ratings Orange-Anise Crepes 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
